section:
Luthetus.Common.RazorLib.FileSystems.Models.IPath Interface Reference Luthetus.Common.RazorLib.FileSystems.Models.IPath A side comment: Windows allow both '\' and '/' as file delimiters. Be sure to check both System.IO.Path.DirectorySeparatorChar and System.IO.Path.AltDirectorySeparatorChar. Inheritance diagram for Luthetus.Common.RazorLib.FileSystems.Models.IPath: Properties PathType PathType [get] bool IsDirectory [get] string NameNoExtension [get] string NameWithExtension [get] Given: { "somePath.txt", NOT_DIRECTORY } Then: NameWithExtension is "somePath.txt" Given: { "somePath.txt", IS_DIRECTORY } Then: NameWithExtension is "somePath.txt/" Given: { "somePath", NOT_DIRECTORY } Then: NameWithExtension is "somePath" Given: { "somePath", IS_DIRECTORY } Then: NameWithExtension is "somePath/" Given: { "somePath/", NOT_DIRECTORY } Then: throw new Exception('File names cannot contain directory separators'); Given: { "somePath/", IS_DIRECTORY } Then: NameWithExtension is "somePath/". string ExtensionNoPeriod [get] string? ExactInput [get] Given: "/Repos\\BlazorCrudApp\\"
Then: is "/Repos\BlazorCrudApp\"

Given: "\Repos/BlazorCrudApp/"
Then: is "\Repos/BlazorCrudApp/"

Overall reasoning: is to return the user input exactly as they gave it originally. string Value [get] Value is the path as a string, but with all directory separating characters having been standardized to be IEnvironmentProvider.DirectorySeparatorChar.
